p: Overall, 132/332 (40%) of patients received a transplant (everolimus 39%, control 42%, P=0.6), with a minority of these (34/132) being allografts in first remission (20 versus 14, P=0.3). There was no evidence of differences in transplantation rates or types of transplants between the arms (any stem cell transplant 39% versus 42%, P=0.6; allograft 31% versus 34%, P=0.6; allograft in first complete remission 9% versus 13%, P=0.3) ( Table 1).
